The following data (columns 1\u20137) are based on <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-b31\"></span>Ebeling et al. (2007)\u2013 Column 1: cluster name in the MACS survey; Columns 2 and 3: The RA and Dec. of the X-ray centroids (as determined from <em>Chandra</em> ACIS-I data); Column 4: redshifts; Column 5: velocity dispersions, in km s<sup>\u22121</sup>; Column 6: <em>Chandra</em> X-ray luminosities in 10<sup>44</sup> erg s<sup>\u22121</sup> quoted for the 0.1\u20132.4 keV band. These luminosities are quoted within <em>r</em><sub>200</sub> and exclude X-ray point sources; Column 7: X-ray temperatures, measured from <em>Chandra</em> data within <em>r</em><sub>1000</sub>, but excluding a central region of 70 kpc radius around the listed X-ray centroid; Column 8: <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-b31\"></span>Ebeling et al. (2007) morphology code \u2013 assessed visually based on the appearance of the X-ray contours and the goodness of the optical/X-ray alignment. The assigned codes (from apparently relaxed to extremely disturbed) are 1 (pronounced cool core, perfect alignment of X-ray peak and single cD galaxy), 2 (good optical/X-ray alignment, concentric contours), 3 (nonconcentric contours, obvious small-scale substructure) and 4 (poor optical/X-ray alignment, multiple peaks, no cD galaxy); errors are estimated as less than 1; and Column 9: ACS bands used here. Note that the clusters MACS J0018.5+1626 and MACS J0454.1\u22120300 are better known from earlier work as Cl0016+1609 and MS 0451.6\u22120305, respectively. For more information, see <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-b31\"></span>Ebeling et al. (2007).</p></div> </div><div class=\"table-overflow\"><table><thead><tr><td>MACS\u00a0</td><td>\u03b1 (J2000.0) (<sup>h</sup><sup>m</sup><sup>s</sup>)\u00a0</td><td>\u03b4 (J2000.0) (\u00b0 \u2032 href=\"/view-large/[XSLTSectionID][QueryString]\">\r\n          Open in new tab\r\n        </a></div></div></div><div class=\"table-full-width-wrap\"><div class=\"table-wrap\"><div class=\"table-wrap-title\" id=\"t1\" data-id=\"t1\"><span class=\"label\">Table 1</span><div class=\"caption\"><p class=\"chapter-para\">Properties of the MACS <em>z</em> &gt; 0.5 sample. The following data (columns 1\u20137) are based on <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-b31\"></span>Ebeling et al. (2007)\u2013 Column 1: cluster name in the MACS survey; Columns 2 and 3: The RA and Dec. of the X-ray centroids (as determined from <em>Chandra</em> ACIS-I data); Column 4: redshifts; Column 5: velocity dispersions, in km s<sup>\u22121</sup>; Column 6: <em>Chandra</em> X-ray luminosities in 10<sup>44</sup> erg s<sup>\u22121</sup> quoted for the 0.1\u20132.4 keV band. These luminosities are quoted within <em>r</em><sub>200</sub> and exclude X-ray point sources; Column 7: X-ray temperatures, measured from <em>Chandra</em> data within <em>r</em><sub>1000</sub>, but excluding a central region of 70 kpc radius around the listed X-ray centroid; Column 8: <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-b31\"></span>Ebeling et al. (2007) morphology code \u2013 assessed visually based on the appearance of the X-ray contours and the goodness of the optical/X-ray alignment. The assigned codes (from apparently relaxed to extremely disturbed) are 1 (pronounced cool core, perfect alignment of X-ray peak and single cD galaxy), 2 (good optical/X-ray alignment, concentric contours), 3 (nonconcentric contours, obvious small-scale substructure) and 4 (poor optical/X-ray alignment, multiple peaks, no cD galaxy); errors are estimated as less than 1; and Column 9: ACS bands used here. Note that the clusters MACS J0018.5+1626 and MACS J0454.1\u22120300 are better known from earlier work as Cl0016+1609 and MS 0451.6\u22120305, respectively. For more information, see <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-b31\"></span>Ebeling et al. (2007).</p></div> </div><div class=\"table-overflow\"><table><thead><tr><td>MACS\u00a0</td><td>\u03b1 (J2000.0) (<sup>h</sup><sup>m</sup><sup>s</sup>)\u00a0</td><td>\u03b4 (J2000.0) (\u00b0 \u2032
